briefTitle: Altitude Sickness Prevention and Efficacy of Comparative Treatments
officialTitle: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Altitude Sickness Prevention and Efficacy of Comparative Treatments
summary: This study is designed to be the first to examine the novel drug budesonide for prevention of acute mountain sickness in comparison to acetazolamide and in the context of rapid ascent to high altitude. The investigators will accomplish these objectives with a prospective, double blinded view of a large population of hikers who are ascending at their own rate in a true hiking environment.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Acute Mountain Sickness
